intro: Lysinema purpurascens, commonly known as the purple tansy, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and Europe. It is characterized by its bright yellow flowers and feathery, aromatic leaves. The plant belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers. Lysinema purpurascens typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in temperate climates. It is often found in meadows and along stream banks, where it contributes to biodiversity.
